content.raw: Yes, that is perfect. I just commented here to make sure that nobody was confused by the original purpose of this PR after @scpeters linked it in [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/478/fix-cpack-now-that-project-name-has/diff](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/478/fix-cpack-now-that-project-name-has/diff) .
content.html: Yes, that is perfect. I just commented here to make sure that nobody was confused by the original purpose of this PR after @scpeters linked it in https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/478/fix-cpack-now-that-project-name-has/diff .

pullrequest.title: Fix logic of installation of CMake configuration files in Windows

content.raw:
Thanks Silvio. I think we are doing the right thing in [ign-cmake](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/src/6d43bfc00ac119d78b3ea790812755a1cf99cf74/cmake/IgnPackaging.cmake?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#IgnPackaging.cmake-283), which is used by ign-math >= 4. 

Is that sufficient?
content.html:
Thanks Silvio. I think we are doing the right thing in ign-cmake, which is used by ign-math >= 4.

Is that sufficient?

pull_request.title: Fix logic of installation of CMake configuration files in Windows

pullrequest.title: Fix logic of installation of CMake configuration files in Windows

content.raw:
If anyone is reading this in 2018, the requirement for having two different CMake config install directory in \*nix and in Windows:

    if(WIN32 AND NOT CYGWIN)
      set(CMAKE_CONFIG_INSTALL_DIR CMake)
    else()
      set(CMAKE_CONFIG_INSTALL_DIR ${LIB_INSTALL_DIR}/cmake/${PROJECT_NAME_LOWER}/)
    endif()

was removed since CMake 3.7, see [https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/16212](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/16212) for more info.
content.html:
If anyone is reading this in 2018, the requirement for having two different CMake config install directory in *nix and in Windows:

if(WIN32 AND NOT CYGWIN)
  set(CMAKE_CONFIG_INSTALL_DIR CMake)
else()
  set(CMAKE_CONFIG_INSTALL_DIR ${LIB_INSTALL_DIR}/cmake/${PROJECT_NAME_LOWER}/)
endif()

was removed since CMake 3.7, see https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/16212 for more info.

pull_request.title: Fix logic of installation of CMake configuration files in Windows

update.description:
In Windows find_package(package) finds the PackageConfig.cmake following
a set of path patterns [1]:
~~~
<prefix>/                                               (W)
<prefix>/(cmake|CMake)/                                 (W)
<prefix>/<name>*/                                       (W)
<prefix>/<name>*/(cmake|CMake)/                         (W)
~~~

This commit modifies the CMake config installation to install
them in CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX/CMake (see for reference [2]).

Furthermore it modifies the PROJECT_NAME to match the CMake package
name, so the default CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX will be
C:/Program Files/ignition-math{MAJOR_VERSION} and any CMake package
will then be able (in case the CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX is not changed)
to find the ign-math library by a  find_package(ignition-math{MAJOR_VERSION})
cmake command, without any need of specific enviromental variables
or cmake variables.


[1] : http://www.cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/command/find_package.html

[2] : https://github.com/robotology/ycm/blob/master/modules/InstallBasicPackageFiles.cmake#L175
update.title: Fix logic of installation of CMake configuration files in Windows
